name: David
clues: A man agreeable to God's heart.
The second king of Israel
Jehovah promised his kingdom would be secure.
He struck down the giant Goliath.

name: Abraham
clues: He came to be called 'Jehovah's friend'.
Became a father at age 100.
He built an altar to Jehovah at bethel.
He sent his servant to find a wife for his son.

name: Solomon
clues: Nathan called him Jedidiah
Zadok anointed him as King
In his days, Silver was considered as nothing.
He build a house for Jehovah's name.

name: Timothy
clues: He was well-reported-on by the brothers in lystra and Iconium.
Paul always remembered him in his supplication.
He had unhypocritical faith.
Paul had no one else of a disposition like his.

name: Barak
clues: He was told Sisera would be given into his hand.
He said: 'if you go with me, I will go, but if you do not go with me, I will not go'.
He is listed second among those who through faith defeated kingdoms.
He sang a victory song with Deborah.

name: Jesus
clues: He is the permanent heir to David's throne.
He is the chief agent and Perfecter of our faith.
Crowds were astounded at his way of teaching.
He gave my life as a ransom in exchange for many.

name: Hannah
clues: A beloved wife of Elkanah.
She was a woman under great stress.
She prayed to Jehovah for a son and made a vow.
Out of great anguish and distress she spoke.

name: Korah
clues: He died when the fire consumed 250 men.
He rebelled against Moses, along with Dathan and Abiram.

name: Eutychus
clues: While in a deep sleep, he fell three stories and died.
He listened to Paul while seated in a window.
People were comforted when Paul resurrected him.

name: Mark
clues: He identified the one who helped cary Jesu's torture stake.
Peter called him 'my son'.
The cousin of Barnabas.
He wrote the shortest Gospel.

name: Gideon
clues: He built an alter called Jehovah-shalom.
At night he tore down the altar of baal.
His army was reduced to 300 men.
He made a test using a fleece of wool.

name: Saul
clues: He was young, handsome, and taller than all people.
A bad spirit from Jehovah terrorized him.
First King of Israel.
He felt obligated to offer up a burnt sacrifice.

name: Cain
clues: He said his punishment was too great to bear.
He was a cultivator of the ground.
God did not look with any favor on his offering.
He asked if he was his brother Guardian.

name: Abraham
clues: He came to be called 'Jehovah's friend'.
Became a father at age 100.
He built an altar to Jehovah at bethel.
He sent his servant to find a wife for his son.

name: Ruth
clues: Obed was her son.
She ate roasted grain handed to her.
Her Husband, Mahlon, died.
She was a moabitess.

name: Jezebel
clues: She vowed to kill Elijah.
The dogs ate her flesh.
Obadiah hid 100 prophets from her.
She painted her eyes with black paint.

name: Dathan
Abiram
clues: Two sons of Eliab.
They accused Moses of making himself a ruler.
They were with Korah in a fight against Moses.
The earth swallowed them up and their houseolds.

name: Aaron
clues: He spoke against Moses for marrying a Cushite Woman.
The Nile turned to blood when struct with his rod.
His son, Eleazer, succeed his as priest in Israel.
His son, Nadab and Abihu, were killed by Jehovah.

name: Samson
clues: He carried the doors of the city gate to the top of the mountain.
He ate honey out of a lion's corpse.
Son of Manoah.
He struck down 1000 men with a fresh jawbone of a male donkey.

name: Samuel
clues: He anointed David as King.
He set up a stone and called it Ebenezer.
He was confirmed has Jehovah's prophet.
The people asked him to appoint a king over them.

name: Jeremiah
clues: Son of Hilkiah, the priest.
He pronounced woe to the shepherds.
He said he was just a boy
In his writting is the illustration of the potter.

name: Naomi
clues: Wife of Elimelech.
She had two sons, Mahlon and Chilion who died.
Mother-in-law of ruth.
She asked to be called Mara, for the Almighty has made life very bitter for her.

name: Isaac
clues: His wife was Rebekah.
Son of Abraham and Sarah.
Paul called him son of the free woman.
He was 60 years old when his twin sons were born.

name: Joshua
clues: The minister of Moses.
The son of Nun.
Successor of Moses.
He was to read the book of the law in an undertone.

name: Rebekah
clues: Isaac's wife.
Laban's sister.
Daughter of Bethuel.
Her sons were Jacob and Esau.

name: Lazarus
clues: Mary and Martha's brother.
He had been dead for four days when Jesus ressurected him.
The one to whom Jesus had affection.
He would not have died if Jesus had been there.

name: Job
clues: Greatest of all the people of the East.
He was an upright man of integrity, fearing God and shunning what is bad.
His ten children died in a windstorm.
His wife told him to curse God and die.
He was known for his endurance.

name: Jephthah
clues: A might warrior and son of Gilead.
A judge whose mother had been a prostitue.
He vowed to offer up the first one coming out of his house.
He struck down 20 cities and subdued the Ammonites.

name: Gabriel
clues: He was sent to give Daniel insight and understand.
He announced the coming birth of John the Baptizer.
The only materialized angel to give his name.
He appeared like a man to Daniel.

name: James
clues: Overseer in the congregation at jerusalem.
Jesus's Fleshly brother
Son of Joseph and Mary
Paul gave him a detailed account of his ministry.
He wrote about the wisdom from above.

name: Abel
clues: Adam and Eve's second son.
He was a shepherd; his brother was a cultivator of the ground.
Although he died, he still speaks through his faith.
The first person slaughtered for having righteous work.
Listed by Paul as the first man of faith.

name: Ezekiel
clues: The son of Buzi the priest.
He ate a scroll.
God told him not to mourn his wife's death.
He saw wheels within whells.
In a vision he saw a valley full of dry bones.

name: Nimrod
clues: He was the first to become a mighty one in the earth.
The son of Cush.
A mighty hunter in opposition to Jehovah.
The beginning of his kingdom was babel.

name: Jehovah
clues: The Maker of heaven and earth.
Father of Jesus.
Most High over all the earth.
He is first mentioned by name at Genesis 2:4.
His name means 'he causes to become'.

name: Judah
clues: Fourth son of jacob and Leah. -Ge 29:35
He ssuggested Joseph to be sold instead of killed. -Ge 37:26,27
He was superior to his brothers. -1ch 5:2
His father (jacob) called him a lion cub. -Gen 49:9
Jesus Christ is the Lion of his tribe. -Re 5:5

name: Stephen
clues: A man full of faith and holy spirit, divine favor and power, performing great wonders and signs. -Ac 6:5, 8
Saul approved of his murder.
First Christian martyr.
He was stoned to death.

name: Benjamin
clues: Jacob and Rachel's son.
Esther and Mordecai were from his tribe.
Israel's first king came from his tribe.
His mom died giving birth to him.
The apostle Paul was from his tribe.

name: Noah
clues: A rightheous man, faultless among his contemporaries.
By faith he constructed an ark.
He was 600 years old when the floodwater came .
Father to Shem, Ham and Japheth.

name: Daniel
clues: This prophet undertood all sorts of dreams.
He was also called Belteshazzar.
Prophesied about the rise and fall of world powers.
He would not defile himself with the king's delicacies.
Was thrown into a lion's pit.

name: Luke
clues: The disciple who wrote the account of the ten lepers.
He wrote about the prodigal son.
The beloved physician.
The only one who recorded the illustration of the neighborly Samaritan.

name: Dorcas
clues: Also called Tabitha.
She made many garments and robes.
Female disciple in Joppa.
She abounded in good deeds and gifts of mercy.
Peter resurrected her.

name: Nebuchadnezzar
clues: He dreamed about an immense image and immense tree.
He destroyed Jerusalem.
He made Daniel ruler in Babylon.
He had three Hebrews thrown into a fiery furnace.

name: Queen of sheba
clues: She came from the ends of the earth to hear Solomon.
She gave solomon 120 talents of gold.
She came test Solomon with perpexing questions.
She had seen all the wisdom of Solomon.

name: Haman
clues: He sought to annihilate all the Jews.
Mordecai would not bow to him.
He had a stake made 50 cubits high.
Esther exosed him to king Ahasuerus.
He was hanged on the stake he had prepared for Mordecai.

name: John the baptizer
clues: Son of Zechariah and Elizabeth.
He ate locusts and wild honey.
He baptized people in the Jordan river.
He was beheaded at the instigation of Herodias.
He got ready for Jehovah a prepared people.

name: Rahab
clues: A prostitute in Jericho.
She hid two spies.
James mentions this prostitu as one declared righteous by works.
Her house was on a city wall.
She wanted her family saved from death.

name: Uzziah
clues: He was 16 when becoming king in Judah in place of his father, Amaziah.
He made engines of war, designed by engineers.
It was not proper for him to burn incense to Jehovah and so he was struck with leprosy.
He build towers in Jerusalem and fortified them.
A Judean king, who was a lover of agriculture.
He built tower in the wilderness and dug many cisterns for his live stock.

name: King Herod
clues: He had baby boys, two years and under, killed.
He inquired as to where Christ was to be born.
Astrologers were warned not to return to him.

name: John the apostle
clues: He and James were the 'Sons of thunder'.
Son of Zebedee and brother of James.
The disciple Loved by Jesus.
He outlived all the other apostles.
He reclined close to Jesus during their last meal.

name: Isaiah
clues: The only Hebrew writter who spoke of Immanuel.
Hebrew prophet who wrote about new heavens and a new earth.
His wife was called 'the prophetess'.
He foretold the coming of the Prince of Peace.
He walked about naked and barefoot for three years.

name: Manasseh
clues: King of Judah, son and successor of King Hezekiah.
He was 12 years old when he became king and reigned for 55 years in Jerusalem.
He did what was bad in Jehovah's eyes.
He made his sons pass through the fire.
He begged Jehovah for favor and kept humbling himself greatly.

name: Leah
clues: The wife Jacob loved less.
Oldest daughter of Laban.
Her eyes had no luster.
Two of her sons were Levi and Judah.

name: Goliath
clues: He taunted the battle lines of Israel.
His height was six cubits and a span.
The Philistine champion from Gath.
David killed him with a stone from his sling.

name: Elijah
clues: The Tishbite from Gilead.
He performed the first recorded ressurection.
Ravens fed him.
He annointed Elisha as prophet to take his place.
He ascended to the heavens in a windstorm

name: Tamar
clues: She disguised herself as a harlot to Judah.
Her twin sons were Perez and Zerah.
Her husbands Er and Onan were put to death by Jehovah.

name: Delilah
clues: A woman in the Valley of Sorek.
The Philistines asked her to trick Samson.
The Philistines brought up to her seven fresh bowstrings.
She tied a man with new ropes.

name: Asa
clues: Jehoshaphat's father.
His heart was complete with Jehovah all his life.
An extraordinarily great funeral burning was made for him.
He defeated one million Ethiopians.
He was told his activity would be rewarded.

name: Hagar
clues: Sarai's Egyptian servant.
Her son was Ishmael.
She ran away from Sarai.
She despised Sarah.

name: Martha
clues: Sister of Lazarus and Mary.
She served at an evening meal prepared for Jesus.
She was distacted with attending to many duties.
Jesus said she was anxious and disturbed about many things.

name: Pilate
clues: Govenor of Judea during the time of Christ.
He mixed the blood of Galileans with Sacrifices.
His wife told him to have nothing to do with that righteous man (Jesus).
He wanted to release Jesus.

name: Moses
clues: Jehovah made him like God to Pharaoh.
He was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians.
He was by far the meekest of all the men.
He brought the Israelites out of Egypt.
Nobody knows where his grave is down to this day.
He spoke rashly at the waters of Meribah.

name: Jonah
clues: A prophet, the son of Amitai.
Twice he was told to go to Nineveh.
He ran away from Jehovah.
Jehovah sent a huge fish to swallow him.
Out of the depths of the Grave he cried for help.

name: Samuel
clues: Son of Elkanah and Hannah.
He anointed David as King.
He was confirmed as Jehivah's prophet.
He was 'in favor both with Jehovah and with the people.
The people asked him to appoint a king over them.

name: Enoch
clues: He lived 365 years.
Jared's son.
He was no more, God took him.
By faith he was transfered so as not to see death.

name: Michael
clues: The only one called 'archangel'.
He battle with the dragon and his angels.
He had a difference with the Devil about Mose's body.
He is called one of the foremost princes.

name: Zacchaeus
clues: He joyfully welcome Jesus as a guest.
He gave half of his belongings to the poor.
A rich man of Jericho.
A chef tax collector.
He was short.
He ran ahead and climbed a sycamore tree so he could see Jesus.

name: Matthew
clues: A tax collector and one of the twelve apostles of Jesus.
His record of the Sermon of the Mount is the longest.
He spread a big reception feast.
He traced Jesus' genealogy through Joseph.

name: Laban
clues: Father of Leah and Rachel.
Rebekah's brother.
Jacob agreed to serve him seven years for Rachel.
The Aramaean.

name: Naaman
clues: Chief of Syria's army and a leper.
The only leper cleansed during Elisha's time.
A prominent man before his lord and held in esteem because through him Jehovah gave victory to Syria.
His flesh was restored like the flesh of a little boy.

name: Eve
clues: Mother of everyone living.
Adam's wife.
She was named after her sin.
Jehovah built her from a rib.
She was thoroughly deceived.

name: Caleb
clues: The son of Jephunneh.
He spied out the promised land with Joshua.
At 85, he said he was as strong as when he was 40.
He gave his daughter Achsah to Othniel for capturing a city

name: Lot
clues: Abraham's nephew.
His wife became a pillar of salt.
He was greatly distressed by the brazen conduct of the lawless people.
He chose for himself the whole District of the Jordan.
His herdsmen quarreled with Abraham's herdsmen.

name: Uriah
clues: The Hittie husband of Bath-sheba.
David got him drunk.
He slept at the entrance of the king's house instead of going to his own house.
He was put in the front lines where the fighting was fiercest and died.

name: Eli
clues: He judged Israel as priest for 40 years.
Father of Hophni and Phinehas.
Samuel ministered thought Hannah was drunk.
He fell of his seat backward, broke his neck and died.
He sons were wicked men who had no regard for Jehovah.

name: Cornelius
clues: An army officer of the Italian unit.
A devout man of Caesarea who feared God.
A man well-reported-on by the whole nation of the Jews.
The first Gentile convert to Christianity.
He and his houseold received holy spirit.
He sent men to Joppa to summon Peter.

name: Esau
clues: Son of Isaac and he loved him because it meant game in his mouth.
A skilled hunter, a man of the field.
Jehovah hated him but loved his brother, Jacob.
He did not appreciate sacred things.
He sold his birthright for bread and lentil stew.

name: Rachel
clues: The younger daughter of Laban.
She was a very attractive and beautiful woman.
The wife Jacob loved.
Her son was Joseph.
She died giving birth to Benjamin.
She and Leah built the house of Israel.

name: Deborah
clues: A female judge in Israel.
A prophetess, the wife of Lappidoth.
She told Barak that Sisera would be given into his hand.
She sang a song with Barak.

name: Paul
clues: A Jew, of Tarsus in Cilicia.
He was given a thorn in the flesh.
He spoke in the midst of the Areopagus.
He wrote fourteen Bible books
He corrected Cephas.

name: Shulammite girl
clues: She was as beautiful as the full moon.
She was dark and swarthy.
She was like a lily among thorns.
Solomon called her 'my flawless one'.

name: Euodia
clues: Paul exhorted her to be of the same mind in the Lord.
she had striven side by side with paul and Clement.

name: Syntyche
clues: Paul exhorted her to be of the same mind in the Lord.
she had striven side by side with paul and Clement.

name: Judah iscariot
clues: He betrayed Jesus.
Jesus called him a slanderer.
He is listed last among the twelve apostles.
He threw silver pieces into the temple and hanged himself.
He was a guide to those who arrested Jesus.

name: Elizabeth
clues: Zechariah's wife.
Mother of John the Baptizer.
She said her son would be called John.

name: Esther
clues: Her Hebrew name was Hadassah.
She was beautifully formed and attractive in appearance.
Mordecai took her as his daughter.
Ahasuerus made her queen instead of Vashti.
She wept at Ahasuerus' feet and pleaded with him.

name: Jonathan
clues: He loved David as himself.
David loved him more than the love from women.
His crippled son's name was Mephibosheth.
He and his father(Saul) were swifter than eagles.
He told david: 'You will be king over Israel and i will become second to you.'

name: Mary
clues: The mother of Jesus.
She was among those persisting in prayer in the upper room at pentecost 33 C.E
She called herself Jehovah's slave girl .
She went to Egypt with her husband and son.

name: Abigail
clues: She was discerning and beautiful.
Nabal's wife.
Her husband was a worthless man.
She pleaded David not to shell blood without cause.
She was blessed for her good sense.

name: Peter
clues: He and his brother, Andrew, were fishermen.
He resurrected Dorcas.
He preached to Cornelius.
He was given the keys of the Kingdom.
Jesus told him to feed and shepherd his sheep.

name: Philip(apostle)
clues: An apostle from Bethsaida, the city of Andew and Peter.
He found Nathanael.
He ask Jesus to show them the Father.
He is usually listed together with Bartholomew.

name: Sarah
clues: Abraham's first wife.
Mother of Isaac.
She called her husband lord.
Jehovah plagued Pharaoh because of her.

name: Jehu
clues: He drove his chariot like a madman.
Anointed as king by Elisha's attendant.
He was told to strike down the house of Ahab.
At his order, Jezebel was thrown from a window.

name: Satan
clues: He was a murderer when he began.
He is called the accuser of our brothers.
Also known as Beelzebub, ruler of the demons.
He walks about like a lion to devour someone.
He will bound for 1,000 years.

name: Philip(evangelist)
clues: The evangelizer.
He had four unmaried daughters who prophesied.
He explained Isaiah to an Ethiopian eunuch.
He declared the good news to all the cities from Ashdod to Caesarea.

name: Bath-sheba
clues: Solomon's mother.
Wife of Uriah the Hittite.
Later she became wife of David.
Solomon had a throne set for her.
Mothered Shimea, Shobab, and Nathan in Jerusalem.

name: Adam
clues: The first man who became a living person and who was created in God's image.
In him all are dying.
He named every wild animal, domestic animal, and flying creature.
He lived 930 years.
Eve's husband.

name: Balaam
clues: Balak asked his to curse Israel.
Son of Beor at Pethor.
He loved the reward of wrongdoing.
His donkey spoke to him.

name: Thomas
clues: Jesus' apostle.
Jesus told him to stop doubting.
Called 'The Twin'.
He urges his fellow disciples: 'Let us go, so that we may die with (jesus).

name: Mary magdalene
clues: Seven demons came out of her.
She continued sitting before Jesus' grave with Mary.
She brought the news that she had seen the lord.
She came with the othe Mary to view Jesus' grave.

name: Joseph
clues: Jacob's first son by Rachel.
Jacob Loved him more than all his other sons.
Sold to the Ishmaelites for 20 silver pieces.
He said interpretation belong to God.
Pharoah put him over all the land of Egypt.
He left his garment in the hand of Potiphar's wife.

name: Dathan
Abiram
clues: Two sons of Eliab.
They accused Moses of making himself a ruler.
The eath swallowed them up and their households.
They were with Korah in a fight against Moses.

name: Mary -Lazurus' sister
clues: She wiped Jesus' feet dry with her hair.
She sat down at the feet of Jesus.
When he saw her weeping, Jesus groaned within himself.
Jesus said she chose the good portion.

name: Shadrach
Meshach
Abednego
clues: Companion of Daniel.
Youth without any defect.
Him and his friends told the king they would not serve his gods.
Thrown into the burning fiery furnace.
Trusted their God would rescue them.
